results.title: Motion study in action
results.creator_credit: Ralph Barnes and University of Iowa
results.brief_description: Shows principles of motion economy applied to many kinds of manual work. Old and new methods are shown for twelve different jobs, including the following: Sorting incoming orders; assembling and attaching buckles on shoes; opening cartons; placing pies in bags and filling glasses with ice and water.

results.title: Motion Pictures produced by Lubin Manufacturing Company, 1904-1909
results.brief_description:
Compilation of silent motion pictures produced by Lubin Manufacturing Company (Philadelphia).
Contents: Bold bank robbery (1904)—She would be an actress (1904)—Drunkard’s child (1909)—An Unexpected guest (1909)
Films restored from the Library of Congress paper prints.

results.title: Mosquito
results.brief_description: Microphotography is used to reveal the intricate details of the life cycle of the mosquito. Covers the areas of reproduction, anatomy and function as well as disease and pest control.

results.title: Moses Pendleton presents Moses Pendleton
results.creator_credit: Robert Elfstrom, Lucy Hilmer, ABC Video Enterprises, Fort Worth Productions and Momix
results.brief_description: This is a portrait of Moses Pendleton, choreographer and dancer, presenting the artist at home, alone on his 33rd birthday. The film includes excerpts from “Philopolus” and Pendleton’s own “Momix”, and features music by Erik Satie and the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra.

results.title: Morpho
results.brief_description: A surrealistic experimental film on the elusive butterfly of love, where time passes in surrealistic images. Music by Enrico de Pietro. Design: John Stoddart. Camera: J. Luscombe. No other credits available.

results.title: More nuclear power stations = Flere atom kraftvoeker
results.brief_description: An examination of the operations required to enable nuclear power stations to function. Deals with the maintenance of reactors, the disposal of wastes and other factors related to this controversial source of energy.

results.title: Mopokes in action
results.brief_description: A scout training film showing the patrol system at work. The activities of a patrol, “The Mopokes”, including a weekly patrol meeting, a patrol outing and a patrol camp. The broadening of the patrol leader’s outlook is shown by his trip to a jamboree and his ability to help his patrol by virtue of having gained his 1st Class badge. How the patrol system offers the Scoutmaster the opportunity of developing leadership in boys.

results.title: Moonchild
results.creator_credit: Anne Makepeace and Anne Makepeace Productions
results.brief_description: A dramatised re-enactment of the methods used by the Reverend Keith Moon’s Unification Church to brainwash young people into joining the church and carrying out its work. Actual ex-members of the group, who have now been deprogrammed, appear in the film as themselves, providing a frightening portrayal of their gradual conversion to the philosophy of the Moonies. Shows the deprogramming methods used by ex-Moonies on young people who still adhere to the beliefs of Keith Moon. An excellent insight into the power of group psychology, highlighting how vulnerable and aimless people can be easily controlled and exploited when removed from such support groups as family and friends. Suitable for upper secondary level.
